xxxGIDHxxx 
xxxGIDExxx 
असाधारण 
EXTRAORDINARY 
भाग II—खण् ड 3—उप-खण् ड (ii) 
PART II—Section 3—Sub-section (ii) 
प्राजधकार से प्रकाजित 
PUBLISHED BY AUTHORITY 
 
सं. 1119] 
नई दिल्ली, मंगलवार, माचच 11, 2025/फाल् गुन 20, 1946 
 
No. 1119] 
NEW DELHI, TUESDAY, MARCH 11, 2025/PHALGUNA 20, 1946 
 
सी.जी.-डी.एल.-अ.-11032025-261558
CG-DL-E-11032025-261558

MINISTRY OF ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS 
NOTIFICATION 
New Delhi, the 11th March, 2025 
S.O. 1132(E).—Whereas by notification of the Government of India in the Ministry of Road Transport and 
Highways number S.O. 1192(E) dt. 03/12/2001 and number S.O. 465 (E) dated the 26th April, 2002 issued under 
Section 11 of the National Highway Authority of India Act 1988 (68 of 1988), the Central Government has entrusted 
the stretches from km 143.00 to km 160.00 (Gondal-Ribda section) and from Km. 0.00 to 143.00 and 160.00 to Km. 
217.00 (Porbandar-Rajkot-Bamanbore Section) of National Highway no. 8B respectively in the State of Gujarat to the 
National Highways Authority of India referred to as the “Authority”); 
And whereas, the Authority was entered into an agreement with West Gujarat Expressway Limited, having 
its registered office at The IL&FS Financial Centre, Plot C-22, G-Block, Bandra Kurla Complex, Bandra East, 
Mumbai-400051 (hereinafter referred to as the “Concessionaire”) for widening of the existing stretch from Km. 
117.00 to Km. 143.00 (Jetpur-Gondal Section), and from Km. 175.00 to km. 185.00 (Rajkot bypass) from two lane to 
four lane and making improvement in the existing four lane stretch from km. 143.00 to km. 175.00 (Gondal-Rajkot 
Section), of the national highway number 8B (NH 8B) and Operation and Maintenance of the said section on 
BoT(Toll). 
And whereas, in exercise of the powers conferred by section 8A of the National Highways Act, 1956 (48 of 
1956), read with rule 3 of the National Highways (Collection of Fees by any Person for the user of Section of the 
National Highways/Permanent Bridge/Temporary Bridge on National Highways), Rules 1997, and rule 3 of the 
National Highways (Rate of Fee), Rules, 1997, and in supersession of the notification of the Government of India in 
the Minister of Shipping, Road Transport and Highways (Department of Road Transport and Highways) number S.O. 
1725 (E), dated the 6th October, 2006, except as respects things done or omitted to be done such supersession the 
Central Government, by notification of the Government of India vide S.O. No. 1083(E) , dated 05.05.2008, authorized 
Concessionaire for collect and retain fees on and from the date of Commercial operation or publication of this 
notification in the Official Gazette, whichever is later: and till the termination date. 
And whereas, the BoT (Toll) Concession Agreement was foreclosed on account of termination of BoT 
Concession Agreement by the Authority and Eventually, the said section has been taken over by Authority on 
01.04.2022 from Concessionaire, after order of Hon’ble High Court of Delhi Dt. 30.03.2022, upon taken over the said 
section, NHAI is continuing the user fee collection as per provision of Concession Agreement/Fee Notification issued 
vide S.O. No. 1083(E) , dated 05.05.2008. However, w.e.f. date of publication of this fee notification, NHAI shall 
collect user fee as per provisions under this fee notification, superseding the notification bearing No. S.O. 1083 (E) 
dated 05.05.2008. 
Now, the said stretch has already been taken up for widening upto six laning on Public Funded Mode, 
therefore, in exercise of the powers conferred by section 7 of the National Highways Act, 1956 (48 of 1956), read with 
rule 3 of the National Highways Fee (Determination of Rates and Collection) Rules, 2008, the Central Government, 
hereby notifies that there shall be levied and collected fees at 75% of the rate specified in column (2) of the Table 1 
for net road section length of 66.28715 Km (Table-2) and for equivalent structure length (having length more than 
60m) of 11.1285 km (having length of 1.11285 km (Table-3) during construction period without annual revision and 
at the rate specified in column (2) of the Table 1 for net road section length of 65.18715 Km (Table-2) and for 
equivalent structure length (having length more than 60m) of 22.1285 km (having length of 2.21285 km (Table-3) 
after completion of six laning, for use of four or more lane sections on the type of vehicles specified in Table 1 below, 
and authorises the Authority to collect, either through its officials or through a contractor, the said fee, as under:- 
 Table 1 
Type of vehicle 
Base rate of fee per km for the base 
year 2007-08 (in Rupees) 
(1) 
(2)

0.65

 2. In addition to above, the following fee shall also be due and payable for the use of the following structures 
having length more than 60 m at the following Fee Plaza(s), by converting the length of structures into an equivalent 
length of highway by multiplying the length of such structures by an equalization factor of 10, -

[भागII—खण् ड 3(ii)]
भारत का रािपत्र : असाधारण

3. No user fee shall be levied for the delayed period between the Scheduled date of completion (910 days from the 
Appointed Date) and the date of actual completion of the project, if it is delayed. For the purposes of this rule, any 
provisional completion of the project shall not be treated as completion of the project. 
 4. The rate of monthly pass for a person who owns a mechanical vehicle registered for non- commercial purposes 
and resides within a distance of twenty kilometres from the fee plaza is Rs 340.000 (Three Hundred and Forty Only) 
for the year 2024-25 and is subject to revision every year as per the provisions of the said rules. 
5. For multiple journey on the highway section, passes shall be issued at the following rates, namely: - 
 
Table 4 
Amount payable 
Maximum number of one-way 
journeys allowed 
Period of validity 
One and half times of the fee for one way journey 
Two 
Twenty-Four hours from the 
time of payment 
Two-third of amount of the fee payable for fifty 
single journeys or more 
Fifty 
One month from the date of 
payment 
 
6. Fee for commercial vehicle (excluding vehicles plying under national permit) registered in the district where the 
fee plaza falls shall be 50% of the prescribed rate for that category of vehicle provided no service road or alternative 
road is available for use of such commercial vehicles. 
 7. The driver or owner or a person in charge of a mechanical vehicle which is loaded in excess of permissible load 
specified for its category, shall be liable to pay fee for entering the overloaded vehicle on the National Highway to the 
fee collecting agency, equal to the fee specified in sub-rule 1A of rule 10 of the said rules, and shall not be entitled to 
make use of the highway section unless the excess load has been removed from such mechanical vehicle. 
8. All definitions including category of mechanical vehicles, its permissible load, category of exempted vehicles, 
service road, alternative road, etc., shall be as per definitions specified in the said rules. 
9. The fee rates shall be displayed for information of the users in accordance with rules 12 of the said rules. 
10. Based on the base rate of fee per kilometre for the base year 2007-2008 as mentioned in Table 1 above, the 
actual amount of fee to be charged from the mechanical vehicles and the discounts will be calculated by the Authority 
on the basis of the completed length of the section and revised annually in accordance with the Rule 5 of the said rules 
and the same shall be published in at least one newspaper in English and vernacular language. 
11. The estimated capital cost of the project is Rupees 1815.81 crore. The capital cost is subject to variation as the 
activities of land acquisition, utility shifting, tree cutting etc., are yet to be completed. The Authority shall maintain a 
record of the recovery of capital cost through user fee realised. 
 
 (F. No. NHAI/2018/Raj-Gon./Jet/Toll/Vol.01/F--/D-1116Dated17.09.2021/E-236373) 
KAMLESH CHATURVEDI, Jt. Secy. 
 
 
 
 
 
Uploaded by Dte. of Printing at Government of India Press, Ring Road, Mayapuri, New Delhi-110064 
and Published by the Controller of Publications, Delhi-110054.

document_type.purpose: To announce and regulate the collection of user fees on a section of National Highway 8B in Gujarat, India, due to a change in the project's funding model and operational status.

document_structure.title: MINISTRY OF ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS NOTIFICATION
document_structure.content_summary: This notification from the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways concerns the collection of fees for the use of a section of National Highway 8B in Gujarat, which is being widened to six lanes.

subsections.title: Table 1
subsections.content_summary: This table lists the base rates of fees per kilometer for different types of vehicles.

subsections.title: Table-2
subsections.content_summary: This table specifies the location of toll plazas and the length of road for which fees are payable during and after the construction period.

subsections.title: Table-3
subsections.content_summary: This table details the fees payable for the use of structures (bridges, flyovers) with lengths greater than 60 meters, converting their length into an equivalent road length.

summary.brief_summary: This document is a notification from the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways regarding the collection of user fees (tolls) on National Highway 8B in Gujarat, India. It outlines the fee structure, vehicle categories, and other related regulations for the use of the highway section.
summary.executive_summary: The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways has issued a notification authorizing the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) to collect user fees on a section of National Highway 8B in Gujarat. This notification supersedes a previous one and details the fee structure for various vehicle types, including cars, trucks, and heavy machinery. The fees are to be collected at specific toll plazas, with different rates applicable during and after the completion of the six-laning project. The document also specifies provisions for monthly passes, discounts for local commercial vehicles, and penalties for overloaded vehicles. The notification further includes details on the capital cost of the project and the process for annual revisions of the fee rates.
summary.detailed_summary: This document, published in the Gazette of India, is a notification from the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways concerning the collection of user fees on National Highway 8B in Gujarat. The notification references previous agreements and authorizations related to the highway section, including the entrustment of the road to the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) and a concession agreement with West Gujarat Expressway Limited for widening and maintenance. The BoT (Toll) Concession Agreement was terminated, and the NHAI took over the section. The notification details the fee structure for various vehicle types, differentiating between the construction period (six-laning) and after completion. Fees are calculated based on the base rate per kilometer, with adjustments for the length of the road section and equivalent structure length (bridges, flyovers). Table 1 provides the base rates for different vehicle categories. Table 2 specifies the location of toll plazas and the length for which fees are payable. Table 3 details the fee structure for structures. The document also includes provisions for monthly passes for local residents, discounts for commercial vehicles registered in the district, and penalties for overloaded vehicles. The notification also states that no user fee shall be levied for the delayed period between the Scheduled date of completion and the date of actual completion of the project. The document concludes with information on the estimated capital cost of the project and the process for annual revisions of the fee rates, which will be published in newspapers.
key_points: The NHAI is authorized to collect user fees on a section of National Highway 8B in Gujarat.
The fee structure varies based on vehicle type, as detailed in Table 1.
Fees are collected at specific toll plazas, with rates dependent on the stage of the six-laning project (construction vs. completion).
Fees are levied for both road sections and equivalent structure lengths (bridges, flyovers).
Monthly passes are available for local residents.
Discounts are offered to commercial vehicles registered in the district.
summary.audience: This document is intended for the general public, vehicle owners, and stakeholders involved in the use and maintenance of National Highway 8B, including the NHAI, contractors, and government officials.

topics.topic_relationships: The topics are interconnected. The 'National Highway Fee Notification' is the overarching document. It details the 'Highway Project Details' for NH-8B, which necessitates a 'Fee Structure and Collection' system. This system is based on 'Vehicle Categories and Toll Rates' and is governed by the 'Legal and Regulatory Framework'.

key_information.main_topic: Notification regarding the collection of fees for the use of National Highway 8B in Gujarat.
key_entities: Ministry of Road Transport and Highways
critical_facts_figures: Km. 0.00 to 143.00 and 160.00 to Km. 217.00 (Porbandar-Rajkot-Bamanbore Section)
Fee for commercial vehicle is 50% of the prescribed rate
action_items: NHAI to collect user fee as per the new notification.
Fees to be levied and collected at the specified rates at the Fee Plazas.
Monthly passes to be issued to local residents.
Passes for multiple journeys to be issued at specified rates.
